intro: Monteverdia catingarum, commonly known as the Catinga monteverdia, is a flowering plant native to the semi-arid regions of northeastern Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, and thrives in well-drained soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small fauna. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
